comment: I don't wear my seatbelt while driving to school because I would rather not make it to his class.

Single is a rigorous and demanding professor. Course is highly structured and challenging and Single frequently challenges his students in-class during lectures. Attendance is mandatory, deadlines are inflexible. Technology prohibited during class (no phone, no laptop), and cannot use Excel.

Exams (3 + optional Final), online, open-note w/ WEBCAM.

Tom Single has breadth of experience and is a very effective instructor who demonstrates the class concepts in a real way and makes them memorable. He teaches with nothing but a pen and paper and is still more effective than most teachers I have had.

GO TO CLASS, and you will pass. Ive never actually learned something from a class but I learned so much in this class! Go to class, write WORD FOR WORD notes and you will pass the tests (they are open notes) Three tests, one group case study (which is test 3), connect quizzes and homework, and he gives extra credit!

Single is very knowledgeable on OM. Helps students in class with examples and answers questions. Go to his class, attendance is mandatory. Three tests, one case study, one group project. I think sometimes with the project and tests, he can have an ego and make it somewhat unnecessarily tough for questions and desired format. That's my 1 complaint.

If you go to class you will pass. His tests come straight from his lectures, so if you write down everything he says you'll do fine. Tests are open notes. There are a lot of group projects for the class so make sure you have a good group. The final group project is worth 20% of your grade. As long as you show effort you will generally get an A.

overall good professor, can tell he's very knowledgeable and experienced about management. Tests are open notes but a bit difficult. Need to write down everything he writes and says for the most part. Attendance not mandatory but i dont think it'd be easy to pass this class w/o going. will send out recorded lectures if you ask tho

THE LECTURES ARE THE TESTS. Keep this in mind for the first one so you don't fail. Going through the book won't matter as he uses real-life examples and includes them in (his own-made tests). So taking notes is a must. He has some weird rules like assigned seating & no laptops/phones. But it wasn't really that bad. Just show up, take notes, easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Class was very organized and followed the schedule. Tests were tough but he offered extra credit and curved them. Projects are short but grading criteria is tough. Homework's and Quizzes easily based off book.

He is a charismatic professor who does a really great job at teaching the material needed. There were 3 tests + a final and just about biweekly homework assignments/quizzes. It was a pretty easy class and all of the tests were open note. None of the questions will be found on quizlet/chegg but WILL be from notes he gave you.

Thomas Single is very experience in the field of operations management. He is hilarious poking fun at Elon Musk and brings very relevant topics of operations management into his class. 

Talking about Chik-Fil-A as a brand intimacy company make you his favorite.
Talking about Chik-Fil-A will make Thomas Single his favorite. Go to class and participate, everything will be great!

Single is great and really knows what he is talking about. He is always accessible outside of class and more than willing to go back over something if someone is lost or confused, never makes you feel like an idiot for it. He writes the notes and doesn't post them so thats why attendance is mandatory. Offers a good bit of extra credit.
Fair grader, you will do well if you go to class. Attendance is mandatory for an A, unless you are something special, which you're not, you go to Ksu.

Professor Single was awesome. He wants you to learn without trying to demolish your grade in the process. He is incredibly accessible with any questions you might have. All you really need to do well in this class is clear effort. Participate in class as much as possible. It is a ton of work, but you learn a ton about real life.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: There is so much work, which would not been as bad if we got to choose our group members. Project after project due so close after each other. He only gives us one sentence of instruction and expects us to figure it out on our own. Attendance is mandatory, and there is a seating chart. Also, no laptops or phones are allowed.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Thomas single is an all around good guy. Great teacher who knows what he is talking about very well. If you actually want to learn, you can learn alot from him. He is very lenient on his grading and actually cares about you doing well. Go to class and you will get an A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Interesting class, easy A. You do not get to choose your group though so good luck. Attendance is a large portion of the grade and you can get extra credit for it.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: If you go to class and take good notes the tests are easy. All exams are open note so that really helps. The cases do not really pertain to anything taught in the class, and while he helps some, it is not enough. He writes everything by hand and uses no powerpoints so its hard to read what he writes. Lots of homework to help boost grade. (kinda)
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Take someone else
He expected us to do work in this class that he never taught us.

His grading system and deadlines are inconsiderate to the student. He takes off 10 points every class you miss. So dont get sick during a pandemic. Get ready to have 2 assignments 2 quizzes and a test due the same morning. Aside from that he puts a lot of effort in the class and the material is pretty useful. But dont take if you have a life.

You're assigned a group you work with all semester on 2 case studies, I had a bad group but not bad. Tests he writes himself so they're not always consistent with the textbook and a lot is up to interpretation. No PPTs, literally just writes on paper and talks for lecture. Go to class or fail. He's fine, but you have to work for your grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He's a good professor and knows what he's talking about but for sure makes you work for a good grade. His tests can be pretty difficult so make sure to take good notes and listen in class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He is a great teacher, if you can take him, DO IT! He makes the material easy to understand and learn the test are not hard just make sure to look over the material before you take it. Loved him!

Since COVID-19 happened, things are different. All tests were online anyways but they're tough in a sense. I thought the guy was alright (wouldn't take him again). If you have an A in the class, no final. I had a B before the final (cumulative), and I just received a C after (which my score was basically a B so he doesn't round).

He is the teacher you want to take. Great guy, knows what he is talking about. Can relate the information to real businesses Gives 5 tests online, but don't let that blind you. You still need to study for them and understand the material to do well. He takes attendance every class, and it's important you go because everything he says is testable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Come to his class then you will know what will be on the test. Take him!

This class is a bit of a challenge but not impossible. Make sure you study your notes, and you will do fine on the tests. Do ALL homework and quizzes; they will help if you have a lower test grade. Single is great, and I wish I could take him again. Tests are all online and lockdown browser! Take him!

Good lectures but doesn't do powerpoints. Connect homework and quizzes. Test are online and timed. group project is not that hard compared to other classes. Attendance and participation are mandatory.
Great professor. Lectures are super interesting. Be sure to participate in class discussions! Online tests in a lockdown browser. Really cares and wants you to learn the material. 10/10!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: One of the greatest teachers I've ever had. Explains elaborate concepts very simply. He doesn't lecture off powerpoints, he uses the board and writes out the concepts. Come to class and participate/listen and take nots and you will get an A. Operations is the best and he uses real time examples to explain the concepts. Very relatable.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: He's great! one of my favorites I've ever had at KSU. His lectures are interesting and the class before any test he plays Kahoot! and gives away extra points if you win. His lectures are engaging- lots of HW, Learn Smarts and quizzes, there is also a group project. Attendance & participation is mandatory. He really cares about his students.
